How does methylation of the MGMT gene promoter affect the prognosis and treatment response in patients with glioblastoma?
column4: When the MGMT promoter is methylated cancer cells are vulnerable to temozolomide leading to a better prognosis

column2: For patients with the EML4-ALK fusion gene in lung cancer how do the different fusion variants affect their long-term quality of life and risk of developing a secondary cancer?
column4: This question cannot be answered with the cBioPortal databse

column2: For the TCGA pan-cancer cohort what is the survival difference and the corresponding statistical significance between patients with mutations in both TP53 and KRAS versus patients with only a KRAS mutation?
column4: Patients with both TP53 and KRAS mutations had a median overall survival of approximately 22 months. While patients with only a KRAS mutation had a median overall survival that was not reached as none of them had died by the end of the study period. The log-rank test p-value is 0.0209 which indicates that the difference in overall survival between the two groups is statistically significant.
This question cannot be answered with the cBioPortal databse

column2: Are there studies that were not processed using polyA enrichment in order to explore lncRNA-related questions?
column4: Library preparation protocols are not contained in the database and should be consulted in the publications underlying the studies.
